direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods determine the change status of elements, but 'isCoreChanged' focuses on core changes while 'isChanged' evaluates all changes.
Both methods rely on the state of changed elements, with 'isCoreChanged' making a decision based on these elements.
Both methods evaluate changes in API specifications, with 'isCoreChanged' focusing on core changes and 'resultApiResponses' on API responses.
Both methods involve calculating the core change status, with 'isCoreChanged' being a public interface and 'calculateCoreChanged' being a private implementation.
Both methods evaluate compatibility, with 'isCoreChanged' focusing on core changes and 'compatibleForRequest' on request compatibility.
Both methods evaluate compatibility, with 'isCoreChanged' focusing on core changes and 'compatibleForResponse' on response compatibility.
Both methods evaluate the status of elements, with 'isCoreChanged' focusing on core changes and 'isDeprecated' on deprecation status.

Both methods evaluate changes in default values, with 'isCoreChanged' focusing on core changes and 'isChangeDefault' on default value changes.
